Instructions:
Prepare the Chicken:

Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the chicken breasts for about 6-7 minutes per side, or until fully cooked and golden brown. Let rest for a few minutes, then slice thinly.
Cook the Bacon:

In the same skillet, cook the bacon until crispy. Drain on paper towels and set aside.
Prepare the Bread:

Toast the bread slices until golden brown.
Make the Sauce:

In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, honey, and lemon juice until well combined.
Assemble the Sandwich:

Spread the sauce on one side of each slice of bread.
Layer the chicken slices, bacon, avocado, tomato, and mixed greens on four slices of bread.
Sprinkle crumbled blue cheese on top of the mixed greens.
Top with the remaining slices of bread, sauce side down.
Serve:

Cut the sandwiches in half and serve immediately.
(Quarter the recipe if just making for 1 person)
